perturbation.original_text:
5.7     Payment  Schedule.  The  parties  shall  make  such payments within
thirty (30) days of the end of each calendar quarter for the Advertising Revenue
invoiced  during  such  calendar  quarter.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.7     Payment  Schedule.  The  parties  shall  make  such payments within
ninety (90) days of the end of each calendar quarter for the Advertising Revenue
invoiced  during  such  calendar  quarter.
perturbation.explanation: Section 5.7 originally stated payments should be made within 30 days of the end of each calendar quarter. Changing this to 90 days creates a direct conflict with the audit clauses in section 5.8, which are dependent on timely and regular payments for accurate record reconciliation, leading to uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
3.     Payment  Terms. All fees will be paid on or before fifteen (15) days
after  the  end of the  month  in  which  the  party  has  received  payment
perturbation.changed_text:
3.     Payment  Terms. All fees will be paid on or before forty-five (45) days
after  the  end of the  month  in  which  the  party  has  received  payment
perturbation.explanation: Original section stated payment should be made 15 days after month end. Changing this to 45 days introduces a conflict. Now different payment deadlines apply for different types of fees within the same larger 'Payment' section of the agreement. This creates ambiguity regarding which payment term is applicable, potentially leading to legal disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
5.8     Records.  SpinRecords.com  agrees to keep accurate books of account
and records at its principal place of business covering all Advertising Revenues
and  associated  commissions.  Upon reasonable notice of not less than seven (7)
business  days,  but in no event more than once per year (unless the immediately
preceding  audit  showed a material underpayment), NETTAXI shall have the right,
subject  to  suitable  confidentiality  measures,  to  cause  a certified public
accountant  to  inspect those portions of the books of account and records which
relate  to  the royalties owed NETTAXI, to confirm that the correct amount owing
NETTAXI  under this Agreement has been paid. SpinRecords.com shall maintain such
books of account and records which support each statement for at least two years
after  the termination or expiration of this contract or after the final payment
made  by  SpinRecords.com  to  NETTAXI,  whichever  is  later.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.8     Records.  SpinRecords.com  agrees to keep accurate books of account
and records at its principal place of business covering all Advertising Revenues
and  associated  commissions.  Upon reasonable notice of not less than one-hundred eighty (180)
business  days,  but in no event more than once per five years (unless the immediately
preceding  audit  showed a material underpayment), NETTAXI shall have the right,
subject  to  suitable  confidentiality  measures,  to  cause  a certified public
accountant  to  inspect those portions of the books of account and records which
relate  to  the royalties owed NETTAXI, to confirm that the correct amount owing
NETTAXI  under this Agreement has been paid. SpinRecords.com shall maintain such
books of account and records which support each statement for at least one year
after  the termination or expiration of this contract or after the final payment
made  by  SpinRecords.com  to  NETTAXI,  whichever  is  earlier.
perturbation.explanation: Changing audit notice period from 7 business days to 180 business days and audit frequency from once a year to once every five years creates a contradiction. Also, the records should be maintained for one year after termination instead of two. This conflict makes it unclear when audits can occur, undermining NETTAXI's ability to verify payments and resolve discrepancies effectively. The ambiguity in audit timing introduces legal uncertainty.
